Name: Fitzgerald
Ingredients: 15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
2 drop Saline solution 4:1 (20g sea salt to 80g water) optional
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon slice wheel.
Review: A Tangy and fresh Gin Sour without the egg white. A juniper heavy gin and dashes of bitters are key to the success of this sour .
History: Adapted from a recipe created in the early 1990s by Dale DeGroff at the Rainbow Room in Manhattan, New York City.
Nutrition: One serving of Fitzgerald contains 162 calories
